Requirements.ValidationEvidence: Completion of the Test Equipment safety checklist is a requirement for test equipment release per HRC-OPS-I-752. The requirement has been evaluated per Appendix B Requirements Validation Checklist in the Requirements Management Plan 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: *Safety Checklist Completion*
Requirements.Description: The Test Solution shall comply with the Test Equipment Safety Checklist 074-8434-282.
Requirements.SafetyRationale: Completion of the Test Equipment safety checklist is a requirement for test equipment release per HRC-OPS-I-752.

Requirements.Rationale: This often comes from the MEE on the program. Identify whether TDMS or another database needs to receive test logs.
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Test Data Archiving
Requirements.Description: The Test System shall generate and store test data outputs in TDMS.

Paragraphs: NOTE: For specific projects, the specific data repository tool (TDMS/MES/etc.) required by the project should be specified here.
If the test station is off the network, capture portable storage or firewall requirements.

Requirements.Rationale: Reversed cables can lead to damage to the UUT when power is applied or bent pins when the cables are mated. It is important to prevent this from occurring as this can lead to significant rework and repair being required on the production UUT in question. In some rare cases, the UUT may be scrapped due to the expected repair cost. However, in some cases where limited connector mates are available, this may not be practical. Therefore, it is critical to work with the design engineering team early on in this process for mates to the UUT.
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: See Rationale and also if not applicable, identify the reason such as the connector mates are not reversible and no alternative exists. In such cases, the requirement may be updated to indicate that special labels or other visual indicators are to be used to protect the UUT From damage. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Connector/Cable Mating Protection
Requirements.Description: The Test System Hardware shall be designed so that cables cannot be reversed or plugged into the wrong connector.

Requirements.Rationale: Often times keying is wrong on connectors. Built fixtures and drawings need to be inspected and connection must be demonstrated to ensure that the keying is properly documented and implemented in the test equipment.
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Keyed Connectors/Cables
Requirements.Description: All connectors and cables with keying shall be correctly keyed to their mating point.

Requirements.Rationale: This is a stakeholder requirement from MEEs in order to be able to optimize the workflow for a test technician who might be running tests on multiple test stations at the same time.
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Operator Input Test Sequence Grouping
Requirements.Description: All tests requiring operator input shall be grouped at the beginning or end of the test sequence, unless otherwise specified by the critical test order in the ATP.

Requirements.Rationale: The prompts need to be clear enough that any reasonable person can complete the instructions. In the past, there have existed test prompts that might reference unreleased or nonexistent documents. If a tool is required to perform an action, reference the tool. If a signal needs to be probed, where is it? If a cable needs to be plugged in, which cable, plugged into what and when. etc...
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The source of this is the MEE. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Test Prompt Clarity
Requirements.Description: Test Prompts shall be consistent, clear, and auditable throughout.

Paragraphs: NOTE:
TE will make prompts clear as possible. TE will review with MEE and techs prior to wording finalization.
These conversations should take place during ATM creation.

Requirements.Rationale: HRC-ENG-I-001, Product Definition Preparation and Release, for marking and product definition instructions.
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Identification Markings
Requirements.Description: All Final/Top level test equipment shall have the corresponding part number, revision, and serial number clearly marked on the equipment per HRC-OPS-P-071.

Paragraphs: NOTE: See HRC-ENG-I-001, Product Definition Preparation and Release, for marking and product definition instructions.

Requirements.Rationale: HRC-ENG-P-039 Acceptance Test Procedure Development
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Test Data Sheet Contents
Requirements.Description: The Test System Software shall produce a Test Data Sheet that contains the following information:

Paragraphs: a. Product serial number at the sellable level of assembly.
b. Product revision level/status.
c. Product part number.
d. Test equipment software part number(s).
e. ATP revision level/status.
f. Calendar date test performed.
g. Quantitative values measured for each test step.
h. Pass/Fail criterial for each test step.

Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The Bid includes all of these relevant UUTs. The requirement has been drafted according to the guidelines outlined in appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001.
Requirements.Name: UUT List
Requirements.Description: The Test System shall be capable of screening and programming the following UUTs.

Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The ability to program these CCAs is tied to the Bid document that is requesting the rehost for these controller Card Assemblies. The requirement has been drafted according to the guidelines outlined in appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001.
Requirements.Name: UUT Programming
Requirements.Description: The Test System shall program all files to the UUT according to the programming parameters tables and/or drawing notes indicated on the UUT drawings.

Paragraphs: NOTE: Applicable UUTs are listed in the UUT List requirement.

Requirements.ValidationEvidence: This requirement would be outlined at bid time and so would have traceability to the bid slide deck. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Tier 1 Boundary Scan Coverage
Requirements.Description: The Test System shall be capable of performing Tier 1 Boundary Scan coverage of the UUT.

Paragraphs: NOTE:
The descriptions for the various tiers are as described below and specific features may be articulated as decomposed requirements for different projects.

Tier 1: Boundary Scan tests and programming accessible on the UUT only. Typically requires simple connection of power and the JTAG bus to the UUT. Actions that can be generated from the Bscan tool menu for Tier 1 level actions are Bscan chain check, interconnect screens between scannable devices on the chain, screens for memory devices accessible from a scannable device, and programming/configuration of memory devices accessible from a scannable device.
Tier 2: External fixtured BScan I/O to expand coverage through edge connectors
Tier 3: Everything else. If you have to do scripting, cluster testing, non-bscan type sublevel elements are all Tier 3

Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The requirement to verify CRC values of files programmed into the UUT comes from PROM Programming Process Specification 580-6049-001. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Programming File CRC Check
Requirements.Description: The Boundary Scan Software shall calculate and verify the CRC value of programming files that will be programmed into the UUT.

Requirements.Rationale: Having the correct sequence information is useful.
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The boundary scan sequences should come from the Manufacturing electrical engineer or production stakeholders. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Boundary Scan Sequences
Requirements.Description: The Boundary Scan Test System shall include the following test/programming/troubleshooting sequences:

Paragraphs: Sequence including all Erase, Program, Verify, and Test Actions.

Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The use of which boundary scan vendor software is typically determined at the bid phase and can be referenced there. In some cases, the decision may be made in the design plan to switch to a different tool in which case, the validation method should be linked to the design plan and potentially marked as engineering judgement. The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Boundary Scan Tool Software
Requirements.Description: The Boundary Scan Test System shall use XJTAG boundary scan software.

Paragraphs: NOTE:
The three primary boundary scan tools used at Collins are XJTAG XJRunner, Asset Intertech ScanWorks, and JTAG Technologies Provision/AEX Manager.

Requirements.Description: The test system shall Interface with either the 828-1A60-001 P6 or P2 connectors provide access for Test and JTAG Signals

Requirements.ValidationEvidence: Power Requirements trace to the Software Load Procedure 946-1UE3-001. The requirement was written according to guidelines outlined in Appendix B of the requirements management plan 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

U25A & U31A SRAM, U39A, U38A, U35A, & U34A FLASH, U18 & U19 SRAM, 429 Loopbacks, Programming​

Requirements.Description: The Boundary Scan Test System shall be capable of driving the following signals to high and low logic levels:

Paragraphs: NOTE:
Signal Name, pin designator and voltage level columns should be populated. In most cases, the voltage levels will be 0 and 3.3V, but that is not always the case.

Requirements.Rationale: Interface with the UUT's P1 connector supplies power to the UUTsInterface with the 2600-0860-002 & 2600-0870-002 P2 and P3 connector provides access for Test and JTAG Signals, respectively, either may be used.*Note 2600 series does not have a ground on P2-28
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: See Rationale. The requirement was drafted according to the guidelines in Appendix B of the Requirements Management Plan 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: I/O CCA Required Connector Interfaces
Requirements.Description: The test system shall interface with the P1, and respective P2, P3 connectors on the I/O CCAs.

Requirements.Rationale: This requirement is driven by design engineering. The test engineers need this information to do their fixture.
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: The Power requirements for the 2600-1760-001 CCA are specified in the SLP 946-24N9-001A Rev - Table 3 EGDP CCA Power Connections.The requirement passes all validation criteria outlined in Appendix B of the RMP 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.
Requirements.Name: Display Processor Power Requirements
Requirements.Description: The Bscan test system shall provide the following voltages at the maximum UUT currents to the UUT pins specified in the table below.

Rows: The +15V rail must be >+13V before the +3.3V and +1.8V rails come up.The +3.3V rail and +1.8V rails must ramp from 0V to operational level in no more than 12 ms. The +3.3V and +1.8V rail startup ramp must occur within 8 ms of each other. It is advisable that the full power-up sequence take no longer than 20ms. Additionally: The +3.3 and +1.8V rails must ramp from operational level to 0V within 20 ms of each other on power-down.

Requirements.Rationale: P5 is a test connector that interfaces with the JTAG pins.P4 is a test connector that interfaces with the JTAG pins.P1 is the power connector for the CCA.
Requirements.ValidationEvidence: See rationale. The requirement has been drafted according to guidelines outlined in Appendix B of the Requirements Management Plan 946-3FG8-001 Rev A.

U54A Local Memory, U35A GE Frame Buffer 0, U45A GE Frame Buffer 1, U15 & U18 Flash, U28 DDR2 Ram, U10 & U11 Frame Buffers, U25, U26 & U27 Video FB,U21 SRAM, Programming ​
